intro: Ouratea tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the warmer months. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
